poem:
**Premium Blues**

The cost has risen,
a phoenix of numbers
in the early April mist.

Tony's flat—
no different, no claim,
yet burdened with
thousand-pound whispers
of corporate greed.

A simple life,
one chair, one bed,
now mirrored in a ledger
beyond understanding,

shimmering with the weight
of invisible gold.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why has the cost of home insurance suddenly gone through the roof? After seven years living in his flat in Hove, East Sussex, Tony Mollett was used to paying about £100 for his contents insurance. Then, in April, he got a renewal notice for £1,076 – 10 times the cost of his last premium. Nothing had changed about the level of cover, nor had he made any claims which might help explain why it had". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
